name: powershell.exe
cmdline: C:\WINDOWS\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -NoProfile -NonInteractive -Command Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "http://localhost:8000/api/edr/processes" -Method GET | Select-Object -ExpandProperty processes | Select-Object -First 10 | Format-Table pid, name, cpu_percent, memory_percent

name: powershell.exe
cmdline: C:\WINDOWS\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -NoProfile -NonInteractive -Command Write-Host "Updating threat feeds (this may take 30-60 seconds)..."; Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "http://localhost:8000/api/edr/threat-intel/update" -Method POST -TimeoutSec 120 | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 3

name: powershell.exe
cmdline: C:\WINDOWS\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -NoProfile -NonInteractive -Command Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "http://localhost:8000/api/edr/threat-intel/search?limit=5" -Method GET | Select-Object -ExpandProperty results | Format-Table type, value, source, severity

name: powershell.exe
cmdline:
C:\WINDOWS\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -NoProfile -NonInteractive -Command git add -A; git commit -m "feat: Professional EDR dashboard with risk score, MITRE heatmap, hunting, response actions

Dashboard now includes:
- Security posture widget (0-100 score, A-F grade, trend)
- Actionable recommendations panel
- Sub-tabs: Overview, Threat Hunt, Response, MITRE ATT&CK
- Threat hunting with query syntax
- Response actions UI (kill process, block IP, quarantine file)
- Blocked IPs and quarantined files management
- MITRE ATT&CK heatmap with tactic coverage
- Response action history

Feature parity with enterprise EDR dashboards."

name: powershell.exe
cmdline:
C:\WINDOWS\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -NoProfile -NonInteractive -Command Write-Host "=== 5. CHECK CONNECTIONS AGAINST THREAT INTEL ===" -ForegroundColor Cyan
$conns = (Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "http://localhost:8000/api/connections" -TimeoutSec 5).connections
$uniqueIps = $conns | Where-Object { $_.remote_ip -and $_.remote_ip -ne "127.0.0.1" } | Select-Object -ExpandProperty remote_ip -Unique
Write-Host "Unique remote IPs: $($uniqueIps.Count)"
Write-Host "Checking first 10 against threat intel..."

$checkIps = $uniqueIps | Select-Object -First 10
$body = @{ values = $checkIps } | ConvertTo-Json
$result = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "http://localhost:8000/api/edr/threat-intel/check" -Method POST -Body $body -ContentType "application/json"
Write-Host "Checked: $($result.total_checked), Malicious: $($result.matches)"
$result.results | Where-Object { $_.is_malicious } | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 3

name: powershell.exe
cmdline:
C:\WINDOWS\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -NoProfile -NonInteractive -Command Write-Host "=== CHECK CONNECTION STRUCTURE ===" -ForegroundColor Cyan
(Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "http://localhost:8000/api/connections" -TimeoutSec 5).connections | Select-Object -First 3 | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 2

name: powershell.exe
powershell.exe
cmdline:
C:\WINDOWS\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -NoProfile -NonInteractive -Command # This command will generate a new PowerShell alert
Write-Host "Generating new event..."
Start-Sleep -Seconds 2

# Check process events now
$events = (Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "http://localhost:8000/api/edr/processes/events?limit=5" -TimeoutSec 5).events
Write-Host "`nRecent Process Events:" -ForegroundColor Cyan
$events | ForEach-Object {
    $mitre = if ($_.mitre_techniques.Count -gt 0) { $_.mitre_techniques -join ',' } else { 'none' }
    Write-Host "  $($_.event_type): $($_.name) | Severity: $($_.severity) | MITRE: $mitre"
}

# Check timeline
$timeline = (Invoke-RestMethod -Uri "http://localhost:8000/api/edr/timeline?minutes=5" -TimeoutSec 5)
Write-Host "`nTimeline (last 5 min): $($timeline.total) events"

name: powershell.exe
powershell.exe
